p: Information on gender, age, exposure to traffic pollution and garages or stations, global climate variability (El Nino and La Nina), and local climate (dry and rainy seasons) was obtained. Climate changes caused by global warming conditions caused climate variability, which was defined as short-term fluctuations around the mean climate state. Climate variability also refers to changes in climate patterns such as precipitation, weather conditions, temperature and humidity [ 16]. El Nino Southern Oscillation is associated with climate changes in the tropical and sub-tropical regions as a result of temperature anomalies from the warming and cooling of the ocean surface [ 18, 19].
